# Checklist: Initial Case Triage

<!-- 
  Purpose: Ensure systematic and complete initial case assessment.
  Usage: Complete for every new contentious probate matter at file opening.
  Importance: Identifies risks, deadlines, conflicts, and planning needs early.
-->

---

## Instructions

- Complete this checklist at file opening
- Check each item as completed
- Note any issues or concerns in the comments section
- Review with supervisor before proceeding
- File completed checklist in administration section
- Update as new information emerges

---

## Matter Information

**Matter Reference:** ........................  
**Client Name:** ........................  
**Fee Earner:** ........................  
**Supervising Partner:** ........................  
**Date File Opened:** ........................  
**Date Checklist Completed:** ........................

---

## 1. CLIENT IDENTIFICATION AND VERIFICATION

### Client Identity

- [ ] Client's full name verified
- [ ] Client's date of birth obtained
- [ ] Client's current address confirmed
- [ ] Client's contact details (phone, email) obtained
- [ ] Client's preferred contact method noted

### Identity Verification (AML Compliance)

- [ ] Photo ID obtained (passport / driving licence)
  - Type: ........................ 
  - Verified by: ........................ 
  - Date: ........................

- [ ] Proof of address obtained (dated within 3 months)
  - Type: ........................
  - Verified by: ........................ 
  - Date: ........................

- [ ] Identity verification recorded in case management system
- [ ] Copies of ID documents taken and filed

### Client Capacity and Vulnerability

- [ ] Client has capacity to instruct (no concerns identified)
- [ ] Client is not vulnerable / appropriate measures in place for vulnerable client
- [ ] If concerns about capacity: [Action taken: ........................]
- [ ] If vulnerable client: [Measures implemented: ........................]

### Source of Funds / Money Laundering

- [ ] Source of funds for costs discussed and noted
- [ ] Money laundering risk assessed as: [ ] Low [ ] Medium [ ] High
- [ ] If medium/high risk: [Additional steps taken: ........................]
- [ ] Any suspicious activity: [ ] No [ ] Yes - [Action: ........................]

---

## 2. CONFLICT OF INTEREST CHECKS

### Conflict Searches Completed

- [ ] Conflict search run for client
- [ ] Conflict search run for deceased
- [ ] Conflict search run for all known beneficiaries
- [ ] Conflict search run for executor(s)/administrator(s)
- [ ] Conflict search run for other parties mentioned
- [ ] Conflict search run for opponent solicitors (if known)

### Conflict Results

- [ ] No conflicts identified - clear to proceed
- [ ] Potential conflict identified but resolved: [Details: ........................]
- [ ] Conflict exists - cannot act: [Action: ........................]
- [ ] Information barrier required: [Details: ........................]
- [ ] Client consent to potential conflict obtained: [Date: ........................]

### Recorded Information

- [ ] Conflict check results recorded in case management system
- [ ] Conflict check documentation filed
- [ ] If conflict, referral made to: [........................]

---

## 3. RETAINER AND COSTS

### Retainer Documentation

- [ ] Terms of business sent to client
- [ ] Client care letter sent
- [ ] Terms of business signed and returned
- [ ] Complaints procedure provided
- [ ] Data protection notice provided (GDPR)

### Costs Information

- [ ] Initial costs estimate provided
  - Estimated costs: £........................ to £........................
  - Basis: [ ] Hourly rates [ ] Fixed fee [ ] CFA [ ] Other: ........................

- [ ] Costs to key stages discussed:
  - Pre-action: £........................
  - To close of pleadings: £........................
  - To trial: £........................

- [ ] Disbursements estimate provided: £........................
- [ ] Costs risks explained to client
- [ ] Client's budget / ability to pay discussed
- [ ] Payment terms agreed:  [ ] Private funding [ ] Insurance [ ] CFA [ ] Other

### Funding Arrangements

- [ ] Funding source confirmed: ........................
- [ ] If insurance: Policy details obtained and verified
- [ ] If CFA: CFA signed and explained
- [ ] If ATE insurance needed: Quote obtained / policy arranged
- [ ] Payment on account received: £........................ (Date: ........................)

---

## 4. CASE DETAILS

### The Deceased

- [ ] Full name obtained
- [ ] Date of birth obtained
- [ ] Date of death obtained
- [ ] Last address obtained
- [ ] Domicile confirmed
- [ ] Marital status at death confirmed
- [ ] Details of family members obtained

### The Estate

- [ ] Approximate value of estate obtained: £........................
- [ ] Main assets identified
- [ ] Real property details obtained
- [ ] Liabilities identified
- [ ] Grant status confirmed: [ ] Obtained [ ] Pending [ ] Not yet applied

### The Dispute

- [ ] Nature of dispute identified: [........................]
- [ ] Type of claim: [ ] Capacity [ ] Undue influence [ ] Knowledge/approval [ ] Inheritance Act 
                     [ ] Proprietary estoppel [ ] Executor dispute [ ] Other: ........................

- [ ] Opposing parties identified
- [ ] Previous correspondence reviewed (if any)
- [ ] Current status of estate administration understood

---

## 5. LIMITATION AND URGENCY

### Limitation Analysis

- [ ] Cause of action identified: [........................]
- [ ] Limitation period identified: [........................]
- [ ] Limitation expiry date calculated: [........................]
- [ ] Days/months until limitation expiry: [........................]

### Specific Limitation Issues

For Inheritance Act Claims:
- [ ] Date of grant identified: [........................]
- [ ] 6-month deadline: [........................]
- [ ] Within time / Outside time / Permission required

For Other Claims:
- [ ] Laches principles considered
- [ ] Delay issues identified: [........................]

### Urgent Actions Required

- [ ] No urgent action required
- [ ] Urgent action needed: 
  - [ ] Issue protective proceedings by [date]
  - [ ] Enter caveat by [date]
  - [ ] Apply for interim injunction
  - [ ] Other: [........................]

### Diary Entries

- [ ] Limitation deadline diarized with advance warnings
- [ ] Other critical dates diarized: [........................]
- [ ] Reminder system set up in case management system

---

## 6. PRELIMINARY MERITS ASSESSMENT

### Legal Merit

- [ ] Legal basis for claim appears: [ ] Strong [ ] Reasonable [ ] Uncertain [ ] Weak

- [ ] Supporting legal authorities identified
- [ ] Potential defenses considered
- [ ] Procedural issues identified: [........................]

### Evidence Quality

- [ ] Available evidence appears: [ ] Strong [ ] Moderate [ ] Limited [ ] Weak

- [ ] Key documents identified:
  - [ ] Will(s)
  - [ ] Medical records
  - [ ] Correspondence
  - [ ] Financial records
  - [ ] Other: [........................]

- [ ] Witness evidence available: [ ] Yes [ ] No
- [ ] Expert evidence likely needed: [ ] Yes [ ] No - Type: [........................]

### Prospects of Success

- [ ] Preliminary prospects assessment: 
  - [ ] >70% (Strong)
  - [ ] 50-70% (Reasonable)
  - [ ] 30-50% (Uncertain)
  - [ ] <30% (Weak)

- [ ] Assessment basis: [........................]

### Risks and Challenges

- [ ] Legal risks identified: [........................]
- [ ] Evidential challenges: [........................]
- [ ] Procedural obstacles: [........................]
- [ ] Commercial risks: [........................]
- [ ] Costs risks: [........................]

---

## 7. INITIAL DOCUMENTS

### Documents Received from Client

- [ ] Death certificate
- [ ] Will(s) - current and previous
- [ ] Grant of probate / letters of administration (if applicable)
- [ ] Correspondence with executor/solicitor
- [ ] Medical records / letters
- [ ] Estate accounts / valuations
- [ ] Other: [........................]

### Documents to Obtain

Priority documents needed:
- [ ] Original will from [........................]
- [ ] Solicitor's will file from [........................]
- [ ] Medical records from [........................]
- [ ] Other: [........................]

### Document Review

- [ ] Key documents reviewed
- [ ] Documents indexed in case management system
- [ ] Missing documents identified and noted for action

---

## 8. CASE STRATEGY

### Client's Objectives

Primary objectives identified:
1. [........................]
2. [........................]
3. [........................]

Acceptable outcomes:
- Ideal outcome: [........................]
- Minimum acceptable: [........................]
- Deal-breakers: [........................]

### Initial Strategy

- [ ] Legal strategy outlined:
  - Cause(s) of action: [........................]
  - Alternative claims: [........................]
  - Evidence strategy: [........................]

- [ ] Tactical approach considered:
  - [ ] Pre-action correspondence first
  - [ ] Immediate proceedings
  - [ ] Negotiate before formal challenge
  - [ ] ADR proposed

- [ ] Settlement prospects: [ ] Good [ ] Moderate [ ] Poor [ ] Unknown

### Alternative Dispute Resolution

- [ ] ADR discussed with client
- [ ] Client's attitude to ADR: [ ] Willing [ ] Reluctant [ ] Opposed
- [ ] Mediation appropriate: [ ] Yes [ ] No [ ] Too early to assess
- [ ] Other ADR options: [........................]

---

## 9. CASE TEAM AND RESOURCES

### Team Allocation

- [ ] Fee earner assigned: [........................]
- [ ] Supervisor assigned: [........................]
- [ ] Support staff assigned: [........................]
- [ ] Counsel identified (if appropriate): [........................]

### External Resources Needed

- [ ] Medical expert: Type [........................] - Identified: [ ] Yes [ ] No
- [ ] Handwriting expert (if applicable)
- [ ] Forensic accountant (if applicable)
- [ ] Other expert: [........................]
- [ ] Investigator needed: [ ] Yes [ ] No

### Supervision Level

- [ ] Supervision frequency set: [........................]
- [ ] Next supervision meeting scheduled: [........................]
- [ ] File review schedule set

---

## 10. FILE SETUP AND ADMINISTRATION

### Case Management System

- [ ] Matter opened in case management system
- [ ] Client and matter details entered
- [ ] Key dates entered:
  - Limitation deadlines
  - Review dates
  - Target dates

- [ ] Parties and contacts entered:
  - Client
  - Opponent
  - Opponent solicitor (if known)
  - Other relevant parties

### File Structure

- [ ] Physical file opened and labeled
- [ ] Electronic file structure created per firm standards
- [ ] File divisions created:
  - Client and instructions
  - Correspondence
  - Court documents
  - Evidence
  - Legal research
  - Financial
  - Administration

- [ ] File index created per template
- [ ] Document naming conventions noted

### Initial File Contents

- [ ] File opening checklist (this document)
- [ ] Client ID verification
- [ ] Conflict search results
- [ ] Retainer and terms of business
- [ ] Costs estimate
- [ ] Initial instruction note
- [ ] Client documents received
- [ ] Initial correspondence

---
